ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Hot Key to Re-target Pet
ygData.msgSnippet: Its easily possible to retarget the pet using a hotkey. I have my hotkey set up like this: (Assist/Attack) /assist  /pet attack /pet target Works great,
ygData.messageBody:
Its easily possible to retarget the pet using a hotkey.
I have my hotkey set up like this: (Assist/Attack)
/assist <tank>
/pet attack
/pet target

Works great, I've been using it since 39. Occasionally I'll hit the hotkey
just as charm breaks, and end up with the (partially beat) wrong mob targeted.

I have another hotkey set up for when I want the pet to go after a
different mob from the one that everybody else is fighting(or soloing) It is:
/pet attack
/pet target


I've tried putting a /pet backoff in there, but the stupid pet never seems
to listen, so I've got another hotkey for backoff


Quies Songwind

At 11:26 AM 00-06-28 -0500, you wrote:
> >________________________________________________________________________
> >
> >Message: 23
> > Date: Wed, 28 Jun 2000 09:51:04 -0400
> > From: "Big Daddy Legba" <legba@...>
> >Subject: Re: Crowd control and lament pulling (was grouping thread on the
>Ever quest boards)
> >
> >How to get your pet to attack what the party is beating on:
> >
> >Hot Key "Assist"
> >/g I'm so darn charming!
> >/assist <tank name>
> >/pet attack
> >
>
>Hello!
>I love this hotkey sequence! But is there a way to retarget the pet? I'm
>hopping there is someway to put the function keys in the hotkey, to
>simulate hitting "F1" twice. Thanks!
